name: brat
content:
brat noun [C]
(CHILD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal disapproving a child, especially one who behaves badly: Stop it, you're being a brat! My sister is coming over at the weekend with her brats.spoilt brat She's behaving like a spoilt brat.

US the child of someone in the armed forces (= the army, navy, etc.): army brat He grew up an army brat, always on the move.military brat She was born as a military brat in Heidelberg, Germany. How would you describe your military childhood and the brat experience?
More examplesFewer examplesWhen I was younger I was a complete brat.She doesn't see why she should listen to other people talking endlessly about their brats.She struck him as a typical Hollywood brat - neglected yet indulged, selfish, and forced to grow up too fast.

brat noun [C]
(SAUSAGE)
US informal a type of sausage made from pork (= meat from a pig), spices, and herbs. Brat is short for
bratwurst : People queued up at the food vendors for a brat with kraut. First, put 5 brats in a pan, then add 2 cans of beer.
More examplesFewer examplesTheir brats are now sold at about 4,000 fast food outlets nationwide.I eat venison steaks and roasts, but my kids prefer brats and Polish sausage.I gulped down a can of beer and devoured a couple of brats.
